video_caption: The video opens with a dark screen that transitions to a scene of a woman standing on a stage, addressing an audience. She is dressed in a blue patterned top and black pants, holding a book, and gesturing as she speaks. The background features a large screen displaying an aurora borealis image, with decorative panels on either side. The audience, seated in rows, appears engaged, with some members taking photos. Text on the screen reads 'EHF | New Frontiers' and 'November 2018 in New Zealand,' indicating the event's title and location. The woman continues her presentation, with the audience's attention focused on her. The scene then shifts to a close-up of the woman, with text identifying her as 'Kaye Maree Dunn' and 'AHAU,' suggesting her name and title. The video concludes with a graphic displaying the text 'I am' alongside a stylized logo, possibly representing the event or organization.

In the video, a woman with long curly hair is seen standing on a stage, holding a book in her left hand and a microphone in her right. She is wearing a blue dress with intricate patterns and appears to be giving a presentation or speech. The background features a vibrant display of the Northern Lights, with shades of green and blue illuminating the scene. The atmosphere is serene and captivating, enhanced by the presence of decorative plants and a geometric patterned wall on the right side of the frame. Throughout the video, the woman gestures with her hands, occasionally pointing to the book or making expressive movements, indicating her engagement with the audience. The lighting and visual effects create a mesmerizing and immersive environment, drawing attention to the speaker and her message.

The video features a woman with long curly hair, dressed in a blue patterned dress, standing on a stage and presenting to an audience. She holds a book and a remote control, gesturing as she speaks. The background displays a vibrant aurora borealis-like projection, creating a mesmerizing atmosphere. The audience, seated in rows, attentively watches her presentation. The scene transitions to a close-up of a logo reading "INDIGITAL," set against a colorful woven pattern, suggesting a connection to the event or organization. The video then returns to the woman on stage, continuing her presentation with the same captivating backdrop. The overall setting is a formal event, likely a conference or seminar, with a focus on engaging the audience through visual and verbal communication.

In the video, a woman with curly hair, dressed in a blue patterned dress, stands on a stage holding a book and a remote control. She appears to be giving a presentation or speech to an attentive audience seated in front of her. The background features a large screen displaying a vibrant image of the Northern Lights, creating a mesmerizing and captivating atmosphere. The audience, consisting of people of various ages and styles, is focused on the speaker, with some individuals taking notes or listening intently. The stage is adorned with decorative elements, including plants and geometric patterns, enhancing the visual appeal of the setting. The woman's gestures and expressions suggest she is engaging with her audience, possibly sharing insights or stories related to the theme of the Northern Lights. The overall ambiance is one of curiosity and engagement, as the audience appears captivated by the speaker's presentation.

The video begins with a view of a traditional building adorned with intricate red carvings, featuring a pathway leading to its entrance. The scene transitions to the interior of a similarly decorated building, showcasing wooden carvings and a spacious, well-lit room. A person with long curly hair, dressed in a blue patterned outfit, is then seen standing on a stage with a blue background resembling the Northern Lights, holding a book and gesturing as if giving a presentation. The video then displays a detailed black-and-white map labeled 'Corpus Australia Bandaiyan,' depicting a network of lines and points across Australia, with various locations marked. The person continues to speak on stage, emphasizing their points with hand gestures, while the background remains consistent with the Northern Lights theme. The video concludes with a return to the map, highlighting the intricate connections and labeled locations, providing a visual representation of the network being discussed.

The video begins with a black and white map of Australia, highlighting various locations and pathways, with the text "Corpus Australis - Bandiyan" at the top. The map is detailed with lines and dots, indicating routes and significant sites. The scene transitions to a colorful depiction of Aboriginal art, featuring silhouettes of people, animals, and natural elements, with the text "Song Lines and sacred sites," "Layout of the land (Song Map)," and "Walkabout (a Song - Journey)" on the right side. The vibrant colors and intricate designs emphasize the cultural significance of the artwork. The video then shifts to a person standing on a stage, holding a book, and speaking to an audience. The background displays a digital image of the Northern Lights, with silhouettes of people and animals overlaid on the scene. The person, dressed in a patterned top and dark pants, gestures with their hands while addressing the audience, who are seated and attentively listening. The stage is decorated with plants and geometric patterns, creating an engaging and visually appealing environment. The video continues with the person on stage, maintaining their position and continuing to speak, with the audience remaining engaged. The background remains consistent, featuring the Northern Lights and silhouettes, with the stage decorations enhancing the overall atmosphere. The video concludes with the person still on stage, holding the book, and the audience attentively listening, with the stage and background remaining unchanged.

The video begins with a woman standing on a stage, addressing an audience. She is dressed in a blue patterned dress and white sneakers, holding a book in one hand and gesturing with the other. The background features a large screen displaying an image of the Northern Lights, creating a serene and captivating atmosphere. The audience, seated in rows, appears engaged and attentive. The scene transitions to a picturesque coastal landscape during sunset, with waves gently crashing against the shore. Text overlays the image, reading "He aha te raru? What is the problem?" followed by a message about the risk of losing traditional knowledge and the sacredness of whakapapa, emphasizing the need to earn and preserve these stories. The video then returns to the woman on stage, now in a close-up shot, continuing her presentation with the Northern Lights still visible in the background. The final frame revisits the coastal sunset scene, reinforcing the message about the importance of traditional knowledge and whakapapa.

The video begins with a group of people gathered in a room with wooden floors and light yellow walls, posing for a group photo. The group consists of adults and children, with some seated and others standing. The room features a large painting of a beach scene on the back wall, and the timestamp on the image reads "30/11/2013 21:53." The scene then transitions to a woman standing on a stage in front of a large screen displaying a blue and white abstract design. She is wearing a blue patterned dress and appears to be speaking to an audience, gesturing with her hands. The audience is seated in front of her, and the stage is decorated with purple lighting and greenery. The woman continues to speak, and the screen behind her changes to display a slide with the text "What do our potential customers want/need?" followed by bullet points listing "Easy and accurate identity and whakapapa verification," "A way to stay connected to our culture," and "An easy to use system that can have multiple communication and connection options." The video concludes with a close-up of the slide, emphasizing the text and bullet points.

The video features a woman standing on a stage, delivering a presentation. She is dressed in a blue patterned dress and holds a book in one hand while using a remote control in the other. The background displays a blue screen with a starry night sky and aurora borealis-like patterns. The woman appears to be speaking, as indicated by her facial expressions and hand gestures. The presentation slide visible in the background lists three bullet points: "Easy and accurate identity and whakapapa verification," "A way to stay connected to our culture," and "An easy to use system that can have multiple communication and connection options." The slide's title asks, "What do our potential customers want/need?" The woman's presentation style and the content of the slide suggest that she is discussing the needs and desires of potential customers, likely in the context of a cultural or technological service.

In the video, a woman with long curly hair, dressed in a blue patterned dress, stands on a stage holding a book and a remote control. She appears to be giving a presentation or reading aloud to an attentive audience seated in front of her. The background features a large screen displaying a mesmerizing image of the Northern Lights, with vibrant shades of blue and green illuminating the night sky. The audience, consisting of people of various ages and attire, is focused on the speaker, with some individuals taking notes or listening intently. The stage is decorated with ornate panels adorned with plants and illuminated by purple lighting, adding to the ambiance of the event. The woman gestures with her hands as she speaks, engaging the audience with her expressive delivery. The overall atmosphere is one of interest and engagement, with the captivating visuals of the Northern Lights enhancing the presentation's impact.

The video features a woman standing on a stage, addressing an audience. She is dressed in a blue patterned dress and white sneakers, holding a book and a pen. The backdrop displays a vibrant image of the Northern Lights, creating a serene and captivating atmosphere. The audience, seated in front of her, appears engaged and attentive. The woman gestures with her hands as she speaks, emphasizing her points. The setting is indoors, with decorative elements such as plants and geometric patterns visible on the stage's sides. The video transitions to a close-up of a webpage titled "Āhau," which translates to "Home" in English, featuring a traditional building with red carvings and a sign that reads "Your digital Pataka." The webpage includes a "Sign In" button and a note stating, "You will need your registration key." The video then returns to the woman on stage, continuing her presentation with the Northern Lights backdrop. The audience remains focused on her, and the overall atmosphere is one of engagement and interest. The video concludes with a wider shot of the stage, showing the woman and two men standing together, possibly indicating a collaborative or interactive segment of the presentation.

The video features a woman with long curly hair, dressed in a blue patterned dress, standing on a stage with a blue background that resembles a starry night sky. She is holding a notebook and a remote control, suggesting she is giving a presentation. The woman appears to be speaking, as indicated by her facial expressions and hand gestures. The scene transitions to a slide titled "The benefits of this relationship," listing entities such as Centrality, Auckland & Edinburgh University, Ensipral Dev Academy, and Māori developers in regions. The slide includes a blue pyramid graphic and the Centrality logo. The video then returns to the woman on stage, continuing her presentation with the same background and attire. The atmosphere is professional and focused on the topic being discussed.

The video features a woman with long curly hair, dressed in a blue patterned dress, standing on a stage and delivering a presentation. She holds a notebook and gestures with her hands as she speaks, engaging with the audience. The background displays a vibrant blue and green aurora borealis-like image, creating a visually captivating atmosphere. The audience, seated in front of her, appears attentive and focused on her presentation. The woman's facial expressions and body language convey her enthusiasm and passion for the topic. The video includes a slide titled "Indigenous Team," listing roles such as "Māori Business Leader," "Software Engineers," "Tikanga Māori expertise," and "Digital marketing expert," highlighting the diverse skills and cultural knowledge of the team. The overall setting suggests a professional conference or seminar, with the woman's presentation being the central focus.

The video begins with a slide titled "Impact," listing key points such as "Identity - user control of information," "Secure storage," "Community building," "Governance," and "Reconnection." The slide features a blue pyramid graphic on the left side. The scene transitions to another slide titled "Future application," which outlines potential uses like "Digital Identity applications," "Crypto - based around the community of users," "Upload of other digital media, and document store," and "Personal affairs- legal, financial applications." The blue pyramid graphic remains consistent. The next frame presents a diagram with layers labeled "App layer," "Platform Interface," "Core Services," and "Blockchain," showcasing various applications and services such as "Land," "Health," "Voting," "Education," "Indigocoin," "AHAU," "Single Source ID," "Syllo Communication tools," and "pl^g." The video then shifts to a person standing on stage, holding a piece of paper and a pen, dressed in a blue patterned outfit. The background features a blue, starry sky with a subtle aurora borealis effect, creating a serene atmosphere. The person appears to be speaking, gesturing with their hands, and occasionally looking at the paper, indicating they are delivering a presentation or speech. The video maintains a consistent visual theme with the blue and starry background throughout the presentation.

The video features a woman with long curly hair, dressed in a blue patterned dress, standing on a stage with a backdrop resembling the Northern Lights. She holds a book and a remote control, suggesting she is giving a presentation. The scene transitions to a slide with the text "As Tangata whenua Indigenous approach to partnerships Rangatahi," indicating a focus on indigenous partnerships. The next slide reads "How you can support us," listing "Relationships, Training, Investment, Your thoughts, suggestions, feedback," suggesting ways to support the initiative. The background of the slides is white with a blue triangular design, maintaining a professional and thematic consistency. The video conveys a message about indigenous partnerships and ways to support them, presented in a formal and informative manner.

The video begins with a slide titled "How you can support us," listing "Relationships," "Training," "Investment," and "Your thoughts, suggestions, feedback" as ways to support. A blue triangular graphic is visible in the bottom left corner. The scene transitions to a woman with long curly hair, wearing a blue patterned dress, standing in front of a blue background with a starry effect. She holds a tablet and a book, gesturing as she speaks. The background remains consistent, featuring a blue gradient with star-like dots, creating a serene atmosphere. The woman continues to speak, occasionally looking at her tablet, suggesting she is presenting or discussing the content related to the slide. The video maintains a focus on her presentation, with no significant changes in the environment or her actions.

In the video, a woman with long curly hair, wearing a blue patterned dress, stands on a stage in front of a large screen displaying a vibrant aurora borealis. She holds a tablet and a remote control, engaging with the audience through her gestures and expressions. The audience, seated in rows, watches attentively as she speaks. The stage is decorated with ornate panels and plants, enhancing the visual appeal of the setting. The woman's dynamic presentation style, combined with the captivating backdrop, creates an engaging atmosphere for the event.

The video features a person with long curly hair, wearing a blue patterned dress, standing on a stage with a blue background resembling the Northern Lights. They hold a smartphone and a notebook, engaging with the audience through gestures and expressions. The scene transitions to a white screen displaying 'ahau.io' with a blue pyramid logo, followed by a return to the speaker on stage. The audience is visible, attentively watching the presentation. The video then shows a white screen with 'Thank You EHF Catalysts' and logos of various sponsors, including 'pl^g,' 'centrality,' 'SINGLE SOURCE,' 'BNZ,' 'BELL GULLY,' 'WREDA,' 'Digital Storytellers,' 'THE BLOCKCHAIN BOUTIQUE,' 'EY,' and 'lane neave.' The final frames display two video thumbnails: 'New Frontiers, Aroha Valley 2017' and 'About EHF & the Global Impact Visa,' with the text 'Learn more at www.ehf.org' below. The video concludes with a white screen featuring the 'EHF' logo and the text 'Empowering Human Flourishing,' emphasizing the organization's mission.
